intro: Rapistrum venosum, commonly known as the veined dock, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes other plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins, and it produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in moist soils along riverbanks and wetlands. Rapistrum venosum is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in some regions.
